page.title: 01Essex NE coastal sea area
page.content: This is a flat even landscape, made up of sea, sandbanks, saltmarshes and some grassland. Here 2 large channels, Hamford Water & Walton Channel enter the sea. There is a sandbank,Pye Sand, an island called Stone Marsh & the NE tip of Horsey Island which is a larger island documented in the adjacent square with the main farm. The shore- line, being of soft sand and mud is forever changing shape year by year. The sea has already demolished a sea wall built in 1962. This has not been rebuilt so the sea has penetrated still further inland. Besides the two large channels already mentioned, the sea makes inroads across the saltmarshes, by small channels which empty out at low tide, thus making it possible to walk from the mainland of Walton-on-the-Naze to the islands.
